title: what is font?
content:
somebody know?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063807im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rudos_6166.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063807im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tecnicos_5206.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tecnicos.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063807/http:/typophile.com/files/tecnicos.jpg) | 17.3 KB |
| [rudos.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063807/http:/typophile.com/files/rudos.jpg) | 26.25 KB |
author: gimadi

comments.content:
Close but not an exact match: **[Disparador](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063807/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=Disparador%20-%20Regular&fid=e13bde9fa54107e32b43d04f568cec1f&fsize=60&text=RuDOS%20TECnICOS&fit=1)** by Tobias Sommer (2009, Free for Personal Use)  
The /S is totally off

Another option - also not an exact match: **[Hauser](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063807/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=Hauser%20-%20Regular&fid=bdefc99c038e544e50765f41fdeb6c02&fsize=60&text=RUuDOS%20TECnICOS&fit=1)** by Neale Davidson (2011, free)

[Powerstation](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063807/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/power-station/) looks a bit closer (mainly because of /S), at least for "RUDOS". I'm not even positive it is the same font for the 2 words but I guess you could easily substitute the all thing with Powerstation and recreate this /N which looks custom to me (only character not to have corners cut).
thanks! the most similar is Hauser, the /S it was probably modified, and the N
